verses.verse: For all this I laid <WH5414> to my heart, <WH3820> even to explore <WH952> all this: <WH6662> that the righteous, and the wise, <WH2450> and their works, <WH5652> are in the hand <WH3027> of God; <WH430> whether it is love <WH160> or <WH1571> hatred, <WH8135> man <WH120> doesn't <WH3045> know it; <WH6440> all is before them.

All things come alike to all. <WH259> There is one event <WH4745> to the righteous <WH6662> and to the wicked; <WH7563> to the good, <WH2896> to the clean, <WH2889> to the unclean, <WH2931> to him who sacrifices, <WH2076> and to him who doesn't <WH834> sacrifice. <WH2076> As is the good, <WH2896> so is the sinner; <WH2398> he who takes <WH7650> an oath, <WH3373> as he who fears an oath. <WH7621>

This is an evil <WH7451> in all that is done <WH6213> under the sun, <WH8121> that there is one <WH259> event <WH4745> to all: <WH3820> yes also, the heart of the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120> is full <WH4390> of evil, <WH7451> and madness <WH1947> is in their heart <WH3824> while they live, <WH2416> and after <WH310> that they go to the dead. <WH4191>
For <WH4310> to him who is <WH3426> joined <WH2266> with all the living <WH2416> there is hope; <WH986> for a living <WH2416> dog <WH3611> is better <WH2896> than a dead <WH4191> lion. <WH738>

For the living <WH2416> know <WH3045> that they will die, <WH4191> but the dead <WH4191> don't <WH3045> know anything, <WH3972> neither do they have any more a reward; <WH7939> for their memory <WH2143> is forgotten. <WH7911>

Also their love, <WH160> their hatred, <WH8135> and their envy <WH7068> has perished <WH6> long ago; <WH3528> neither have they any more a portion <WH2506> forever <WH5769> in anything that is done <WH6213> under the sun. <WH8121>

Go your way <WH3212> â€” eat <WH398> your bread <WH3899> with joy, <WH8057> and drink <WH8354> your wine <WH3196> with a merry <WH2896> heart; <WH3820> for God <WH430> has already <WH3528> accepted <WH7521> your works. <WH4639>
Let your garments <WH899> be always <WH6256> white, <WH3836> and don't <WH7218> let your head lack <WH2637> oil. <WH8081>

Live <WH2416> joyfully <WH7200> with the wife <WH802> whom you love <WH157> all the days <WH3117> of your life <WH2416> of vanity, <WH1892> which he has given <WH5414> you under the sun, <WH8121> all your days <WH3117> of vanity: <WH1892> for that is your portion <WH2506> in life, <WH2416> and in your labor <WH5999> in which you labor <WH6001> under the sun. <WH8121>

Whatever your hand <WH3027> finds <WH4672> to do, <WH6213> do <WH6213> it with your might; <WH3581> for there is no work, <WH4639> nor device, <WH2808> nor knowledge, <WH1847> nor wisdom, <WH2451> in Sheol, <WH7585> where you are going. <WH1980>

I returned, <WH7725> and saw <WH7200> under the sun, <WH8121> that the race <WH4793> is not to the swift, <WH7031> nor the battle <WH4421> to the strong, <WH1368> neither yet bread <WH3899> to the wise, <WH2450> nor yet riches <WH6239> to men of understanding, <WH995> nor yet favor <WH2580> to men of skill; <WH3045> but time <WH6256> and chance <WH6294> happen to them all. <WH7136>

For man <WH120> also doesn't <WH3045> know his time. <WH6256> As the fish <WH1709> that are taken <WH270> in an evil <WH7451> net, <WH4685> and as the birds <WH6833> that are caught <WH270> in the snare, <WH6341> even so <WH1992> are the sons <WH1121> of men <WH120> snared <WH3369> in an evil <WH7451> time, <WH6256> when it falls <WH5307> suddenly on them. <WH6597>
I have also seen <WH7200> wisdom <WH2451> under the sun <WH8121> in this <WH2090> way, <WH1419> and it seemed great to me.

There was a little <WH6996> city, <WH5892> and few <WH4592> men <WH582> within it; <WH1419> and a great king <WH4428> came <WH935> against it, <WH5437> besieged it, <WH1129> and built great <WH1419> bulwarks against it. <WH4685>

Now a poor <WH4542> wise <WH2450> man <WH376> was found <WH4672> in it, <WH2450> and he by his wisdom delivered <WH4422> the city; <WH5892> yet no man <WH120> remembered <WH2142> that same poor <WH4542> man. <WH120>

Then I said, <WH559> "Wisdom <WH2451> is better <WH2896> than strength. <WH1369>" Nevertheless the poor man <WH4542>'s wisdom <WH2451> is despised, <WH959> and his words <WH1697> are not heard. <WH8085>
The words <WH1697> of the wise <WH2450> heard <WH8085> in quiet <WH5183> are better than the cry <WH2201> of him who rules <WH4910> among fools. <WH3684>
Wisdom <WH2451> is better <WH2896> than weapons <WH3627> of war; <WH7128> but one <WH259> sinner <WH2398> destroys <WH6> much <WH7235> good. <WH2896>
